name: Anatomy of a Sentence Quiz | English | 15 Questions

questions.text: The cat ran. Which word in this sentence is the noun?
questions.explanation:
cat.

	"The" is an article. "Ran" is a verb. "Cat" is the noun. A noun is a person, place, or thing.

questions.text: John runs on the track team. Which word is the verb in this sentence?
questions.explanation:
runs.

	A verb is an action word. "John" is a noun. "Runs" is the verb since that is the action that John is doing. "The" is an article. "Track" in this sentence is an adjective describing team.

questions.text: We went outside to watch the beautiful sunset. Which word is the adjective?
questions.explanation:
beautiful.

	An adjective describes a noun. "Beautiful" describes sunset so therefore it is an adjective. "To" is part of "to watch" which is an infinitive. "Sunset" is a noun. "We" is a pronoun.

questions.text: The children quickly lined up for lunch. Which word is the adverb?
questions.explanation:
quickly.

	An adverb is a word that describes a verb, adjective or another adverb. "Quickly" describes the verb lined  so therefore quickly is the adverb. "Children" is a plural noun. "For" is a preposition.

questions.text: The goats went over the bridge. Which word in this sentence is a preposition?
questions.explanation:
over.

	"Goats" is a plural noun. "Bridge" is a noun and "over the bridge" is a prepositional phrase. "The" is an article.

questions.text: Wow! That was amazing! Which word is the interjection?
questions.explanation:
wow.

	"Was" is a linking verb. "Amazing" is a predicate adjective. "That" is a pronoun.

questions.text: Ben and Jerry make the best ice cream in the world. Which word is the conjunction in this sentence?
questions.explanation:
and.

	"In" is a preposition. "Make" is an action verb. "Ben" is a proper noun.

questions.text: She went to the store. What is the pronoun in the preceding sentence?
questions.explanation:
She.

	A pronoun "takes the place of" a noun. "She" is a pronoun. "Went" is a verb." "To" is a preposition and introduces the prepositional phrase "to the store". "Store" is a noun.

questions.text: Did you read the new Harry Potter book yet? Which word is an article?
questions.explanation:
the.

	In English there are three articles "the" "a" and "an". "You" is a pronoun. "Yet" is a conjunction. "Read" is a verb.

questions.text: She gave Jim the apple. What is the indirect object?
questions.explanation:
Jim.

	The indirect object can be found by asking the question "Who received the action of the verb?" "Jim" answers "To who did she give the apple?" so "Jim" is the indirect object.

questions.text: Edwin gave the gift to Jacques. Which word would be the direct object?
questions.explanation:
gift.

	"Edwin" is the noun. "Gave" is the verb. "Jacques" received the object of the action from Edwin so "Jacques" is the indirect object. What he received was a "gift", making "gift" the direct object.

questions.text: Jennifer is a girl. What word is the predicate nominative?
questions.explanation:
girl.

	The predicate nominative comes after the linking verb and is another word for the subject. That is "girl" is a noun and "Jennifer" is a noun and they refer to the same person. So the noun "girl" is acting as an adjective to describe "Jennifer".

questions.text: The dog was big. Which word is the predicate adjective?
questions.explanation:
big.

	"Big" describes the dog and follows the linking verb "was" making "big" the predicate adjective.

questions.text: This question is a little different. Out of the following words, which word is a proper noun?
questions.explanation:
Alexis.

	A proper noun always starts with a capital letter. It is a person's name,  the name of a place (Boston vs city), a month (February), a day (Tuesday) etc.

questions.text: Swimming is a great form of exercise. Which word is the gerund?
questions.explanation:
swimming.

	A gerund is a verb ending in "ing" that acts as a noun in a sentence.
